multiplechoiceresponse.p: You've done everything by the book but for some reason, the code in your .css isn't displaying the newly styled 'x-purplebox' you expected on edX. In fact, it's not showing at all, even though you've checked your code in Studio many times. You go back to the .css file to see what's going wrong.
What's the issue with this code?

choicegroup.choice: The variables have been changed from example.css - you should never mess with colours or margins!
The curly bracket is open - nothing after this will work until the bracket is closed to complete the action
The box style reference is changed and missing an 'h' - it should be .hx-purplebox

div.p: It's ok to change colours or margins if you've made that decision carefully, and you don't need to prefix your own styles with an hx (or an x, for that matter). The important bit here is the titchy detail of the closed curly bracket.
